com.perceptus.option

Class Option<T,E extends java.lang.Exception>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.perceptus.option.Option<T,E>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of instance that can be contained.
    E - the type of Exception that might be contained instead of a value.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Absent, Present

    public abstract class Option<T,E extends java.lang.Exception>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An immutable object that may contain a non-null reference to another object. Each instance of this type either contains a non-null reference, or contains an exception describing why the reference isn't present

    Some uses of this class include

    • As a method return type, as an alternative to returning null to indicate that no value was available
    • To distinguish between "unknown" (for example, not present in a map) and "known to have no value" (present in the map, with value Optional.absent())

    See the Guava User Guide article on using Optional. This class imitates the API laid out by Google Guava but augments it substantially. For more information, visit the project page

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • of

      • isPresent

        public abstract boolean isPresent()
        Returns true if this holder contains a (non-null) instance and no exception.

      • get

        public abstract T get()
        Returns the contained instance, which must be present. If the instance might be absent, use or(Object) or orNull() instead.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the instance is absent (isPresent() returns false)

      • or

        public abstract T or(T defaultValue)
        Returns the contained instance if it is present; defaultValue otherwise. If no default value should be required because the instance is known to be present, use get() instead. For a default value of null, use orNull().

      • orNull

        public abstract T orNull()
        Returns the contained value if it has a value present; null otherwise.

      • asSet

        public abstract java.util.Set<T> asSet()
        Returns a Set whose only element is the contained instance if it is present; an empty Set otherwise.

      • hasException

        public abstract boolean hasException()
        Returns true if this holder contains an exception

      • getException

        public abstract E getException()
        Returns the contained exception, if there is one (the value is absent).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the value is present (isPresent() returns true)
